content.body: can we make it a code of conduct violation to post AI-generated bullshit without properly labelling it as such?
that's already a CoC violation.  context?
can you link to the AI-generated bullshit?

I would argue at the very least:  1. be respectful, 2. be considerate, 3. be careful in words

content.body: "AI-generated bullshit" does not sound respectful, considerate, nor being careful with words
"AI-generated meaningless babbling" does not sound respectful, considerate, nor being careful with words
the description for https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/pull/3287 was very clearly written by chatGPT; plausibly also the text included in the PR itself since it sounds coherent but is meaningless
MF: apologies for any confusion there -- I am not saying what _you_ said is not respectful
content.formatted_body: MF: apologies for any confusion there -- I am not saying what you said is not respectful

content.body: i don't think it's a CoC violation simply to have used an LLM, but it's a dick move, and imo due to copyright uncertainties means we're flatly unable to accept the contribution anyways
perhaps we should update the contribution guidelines to be clear about that tho
Yes, this is definitely something we should discourage and unceremoniously shut down, I agree.
* perhaps we should update the contribution guidelines to be clear about not using LLMs tho

m.new_content.body: perhaps we should update the contribution guidelines to be clear about not using LLMs tho

content.body: to be clear, I don't mind it being used or being quoted in part, but I mind *considerably* when it is being passed off as a human
content.formatted_body: to be clear, I don't mind it being used or being quoted in part, but I mind considerably when it is being passed off as a human

content.body: because I have a default level of deference for something someone took the time to write themselves, and it is exhausting to be at the level for something that someone possibly didn't even care enough to review themselves
